definition: to expel/to drive out/to oust
to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: The noisy fellow was thrown out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 这个吵吵嚷嚷的家伙被人从大厅里撵出去了。

sentences.english: What did he bundle the boy out for?
sentences.chinese: 他为什么要把那个男孩撵出去？

sentences.english: He was supplanted out of the house by his wife.
ErNian dont want to die, grandma to her out of the gate.
sentences.chinese: 二娘不愿死，奶奶将她撵出山门。

sentences.english: I think the first order of business is to get you out of here.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，当务之急首先是得把你撵出去。

sentences.english: They were thoroughly rousted out and their camps were destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 他们被彻底撵出来了，营地也被毁了。

sentences.english: Then Moses and Aaron were driven out of Pharaoh's presence.
sentences.chinese: 于是把他们从法老面前撵出去。

sentences.english: Tom routed him out, told him the trouble he had been causing, and urged him to go home.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆把他撵出来，告诉他已惹了麻烦，要他快回家。

sentences.english: A:They wanted to kick me out of the band.
They turned me out of doors, and chained me up here.
sentences.chinese: 是他们把我撵出了门，用铁链子扣了起来。

sentences.english: They bounced the troublemakers out of the club.
sentences.chinese: 他们把捣乱分子撵出了俱乐部。

sentences.english: Anyone who starts picking fights is out at once.
sentences.chinese: 任何找碴打起架来的人就会立刻被撵出去。

sentences.english: The child was taken away from school .
The teacher threatened to kick the impudent pupil out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 老师威胁着要把这无礼的小学生撵出教室。
让我们来把那个醉汉撵出去。

sentences.english: He was backed off the bar.

definition: to drive out/to oust
to drive away
to expel/to evict/to drive out
to drive away
to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
torrent of abuse (idiom)
to send away to serve a penal sentence
lit. to pour dog's blood on (idiom)/fig. torrent of abuse
to offend
to fire/to discharge
to hustle sb away

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
to get sb involved in one's trouble/Taiwan pr. [dai4 lei4]
to beat sb soundly
